a.title: MonetaryComponent.type : The type of monetary component, what the value is to be used for and how that should be applied in its context. e.g. A surchange would increase the cost, a deduction would reduce the cost.

description.value: MonetaryComponent Type: Financial line items use this datatype to commonly categorize the value, and other factors that may effect how the value should be interpreted.

short.value: Types and value of financial information that apply to line item(s)

definition.value: Financial line items use this datatype to commonly categorize the value, and other factors that may effect how the value should be interpreted.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: The type of monetary component, what the value is to be used for and how that should be applied in its context. e.g. A surchange would increase the cost, a deduction would reduce the cost.

requirements.value: Some monetary component types can be further classified and need to be differentiated.
